results.title: America. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
D.W. Griffith’s epic historical spectacle of the American Revolution, shot on the actual locations, and staged with almost documentary realism. The cast is headed by Neil Hamilton, Lionel Barrymore, Carol Dempster and Louis Wolhiem. This is an edited version of the original film which was made in 1909.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Sterling Educational Films

results.title: The Delian problem (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Neil Cleminson, Jean Nunn, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of Mathematics”.
Examines the problem of duplicating the cube, which amounts to finding the cubic root of 2 and is known as the Delian problem. Discusses the reformation of this problem in terms of finding two mean proportionals and the solution of the simpler problem of one mean proportional.

results.title: Quaternions: A herald of modern algebra (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of Mathematics”.
A key mathematical development in modern algebraic ideas was the discovery of non-commutative algebras. William Rowan Hamilton worked on complex numbers and expressed them formally as pairs of real numbers. His work led him to try to generalise his ideas to three dimension but his generalisation to four dimensions led to the quaternion and the first non-commutative algebra.

results.title: Numbers now and then (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jean Nunn, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of Mathematics”.
Concerns the history of written numbers. Illustrates different features of the numeral systems of the ancient Babylonians, Egyptians and Greeks. Explains the Hindu-Arabic origin of our number system.

results.title: A Foreign Affair
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “High Office”.
A dictator comes to power in a former British colony. Conditions in his country deteriorate but business opportunities for Britain are good. The program examines how the British government might view the request for a royal visit and how it would react to rumours of an impending coup against the new regime

results.title: A Nuclear Accident
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “High Office”.
There has been an accident at a nuclear power station and a crisis threatens. Examines how the ministers concerned react and what form the ensuing line of inquiry should take. Among those taking part are former Home Secretary Merlyn Rees and former Environment Secretary Peter Shore
